post.description:
Register a new organization with DitchCarbon. If you've already registered this organization, DitchCarbon will not register it again. Once registered, you can request updated information on the organization using `GET /organizations/{id}`
This endpoint also returns the latest carbon data on the organization.

get.description: Retrieve the latest data on an organization already registered using `POST /organizations`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the organization.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: ISO three-letter currency code to provide revenue and emission factor in.

recommended_actions.recommended_actions: Optimize combustion efficiency through regular maintenance and adjustments. Transition to cleaner fuels, such as natural gas or biofuels. Implement energy conservation measures to reduce fuel consumption.
recommended_actions.case_study: Panera Bread, a cafe and restaurant chain, enhances efficiency by upgrading machinery and HVAC systems.  They stopped conducting nightime baking to reduce carbon emissions.
recommended_actions.suggested_contract_term: Supplier shall optimize combustion efficiency through regular maintenance and adjustments, aiming for a 10% improvement in efficiency within 1 year.  They are also tasked with transitioning to cleaner fuels, like natural gas or biofuels, targeting a 50% transition in fuel usage in 2 years.  Furthermore, the supplier must implement energy conservation measures to reduce fuel consumption, aiming for a 15% reduction in overall fuel usage over 3 years.
recommended_actions.question_to_ask_at_qbr: Can you share progress on improving energy efficiency in your operations?

get.description:
This endpoint is deprecated, please use Organizations instead.

Look up the emissions factor of a supplier.

`ef_kg_co2eq` is the carbon footprint of the supplier per monetary unit. In other words, it's how much a supplier emits per $. You can change the currency of this field using the `currency` parameter.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the supplier

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: ISO three-letter currency code. The response will have `ef_kg_co2e` converted to be in terms of this currency. Currency conversion uses rates from the current day.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Country of supplier's operations. ISO two-letter country code.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Emission factors change over time, so providing a date improves the accuracy of the estimation. Defaults to today.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The name of the supplier's industry. Providing this parameter improves the accuracy for less-known suppliers.

quality.description: A measure of how relevant the returned data is to the request. Ranges from 1 (best) - 5 (worst)

cdp.description: This indicates if a company has disclosed via CDP

link.description: If a company has disclosed via CDP this URL when you are logged into CDP will take you to the disclosure for the requested year.

sbti.description: SBTi shows companies and financial institutions that have set science-based targets, or have committed to developing targets.

date.description: This is the date which the organization's commitment/target was published.

net_zero_committed.description: Is the company classed as "taking action" by SBTI

near_term_target_year.description: What date has the company set to be NetZero by

near_term_target_status.description:
Organizations whose target status is ‘targets set’ have had their targets independently validated by the SBTi.
Organizations whose target status is ‘committed’ have made a public commitment to set a science-based target aligned with the SBTi’s target-setting criteria within 24 months.

near_term_target_classification.description: Temperature increase commitment, these companies are committing to keeping global warming to 1.5/2c

get.description:
We define "product" as "any goods or services."

The API returns two carbon footprints:
  * `manufacturer_declared_carbon_footprint` is the manufacturer's reported value for the product's net greenhouse gas emissions measured in kgCO2e.
  * **Preferred:** `carbon_footprint` is a modified value that uses DitchCarbon's models. Our models consider aspects that have changed since the manufacturer's declaration (e.g. grid intensity) to provide a better estimate.

In case there is no exact product match, you can provide the `category_name` parameter. Use the categories endpoint to find a list of possible categories. We'll return the category average and set `methodology="product_category"` if your requested product is not found.

In case there is no exact product match and no exact category match, we'll use the industry standard spend-based methodology to estimate the carbon footprint of the requested product. The API expects the "price_cents" and "price_currency" parameters to be set in this case.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the product (fuzzy-matched)

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: The name of the organization that supplies the product (fuzzy-matched)

parameters.name: category_name
parameters.description: The name of the product's category (fuzzy-matched). Use the categories endpoint to browse supported categories.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: For example, setting to m3 will make the API return a `carbon_footprint` value **per cubic meter**. Leave blank for countable products e.g. laptops

parameters.name: price_cents
parameters.description: The price of the product in an integer number of cents.

parameters.name: price_currency
parameters.description: Three-letter currency code.

parameters.name: months
parameters.description: The number of months the product will be used for

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The two-letter country code the product is used in.

name.description: The product or product category's full name

carbon_footprint.description: The DitchCarbon estimated carbon footprint of a product measured in kgCO2e per `unit`.

manufacturer_declared_carbon_footprint.description: The manufacturer's report of the product's carbon footprint measured in kgCO2e.

methodology.description: Describes the approach used to obtain the data. `product` when data is from a direct assessment of the requested product, `product_category` when the data is from a product category average, `supplier` when the data is from a spend-based calculation.

404.description: We couldn't match your requested product to any of the products in our database.

200.description: An array of responses. The order of responses matches the order of requests.

post.description:
Send multiple requests to the Ditchcarbon API with one HTTP request.

Notes:

get.description:
Find the kg CO2e emitted by a server. The response is the total CO2e released (in kg) by the server throughout its lifetime according to DitchCarbon's life-cycle assessment (LCA).

Find `id` using the `/servers` endpoint.

You can provide a "category" to improve carbon footprint estimates throughout the API. This endpoint helps you decide which category to use by returning a searchable, paginated list of categories.

Pagination follows [RFC8288](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8288).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search term. Results are ordered by closeness to this parameter.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Pagination page number

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: ISO two-letter country code of activity region. Filters the response to include categories that are available only in this region.

get.description: Top-level activities are categories of activities. For example, "Stationary Combustion". This endpoint retrieves a list of available categories.

available_declared_units.description: Units you can assess this activity with.

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all activities. Use the `region` and `name[]` parameters to filter by region and activity category.

If you're getting empty responses, leave the `region` and `name` parameters blank.

This endpoint is paginated so the response isn't too big. Use the `page` parameter to retrieve the next page of data. Pagination follows [RFC8288](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8288).

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: ISO two-letter country code or `Global`. Filters activities to only those available in this region. Leave empty to get all activities.

parameters.name: name[]
parameters.description: Filter by top-level activity name.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Pagination page number

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Activity ID
